page.title: 02JOHN HARRISON SCHOOL
page.content: The present school site was established in 1890 and the junior department is housed in this early building. In 1980 the Humberside Authority replaced the Infant Dept.,Hall/Dining Room,Staff-room and toilets.To mark this occasion the school was named after the inventor of the ships chronometer. There are 170 children on the roll of whom some 85% stay for the school dinner on a regular basis. The teachers provide a range of extra curricula activities:football, gymnastics, netball,rounders and swimming. The school is supported by a P.T.A. and it is the philosophy of the school to involve parents within the school with the result that each day several parents give their time and skills to the teachers and children.Many of them attend the Family Assembly on Fridays.
